Title: Wisdom Traits
Summary: Recognize the limits of your knowledge, acknowledge uncertainty and change, attention to context and the bigger picture, integrate different perspectives of a situation,... balance intrapersonal (self), interpersonal (others), and institutional (society) interests,... and emotional regulation.

Title: Blind Men And An Elephant
Summary: Consider multiple perspectives as no single viewpoint captures the whole truth.

Title: Buridan's Ass
Summary: Analysis paralysis between two equal options risks missed opportunities.

Title: Willpower Paradox
Summary: People may do things better by focusing less directly on doing them.

Title: Inventor's Paradox
Summary: Solving general problems can reveal principles to solve specific problems.

Title: Suspension Of Disbelief
Summary: Ignoring the impossible aspects of fiction to enjoy it.

Title: Occam's Razor
Summary: Explanations that require fewer unjustified assumptions are more likely to be correct.

Title: Hanlon's Razor
Summary: Actions that seem malicious could be the result of stupidity.

Title: Hitchens’s Razor
Summary: Claims asserted without evidence can be dismissed without evidence.

Title: Popper’s Falsifiability Criterion
Summary: Scientific theories must be testable and falsifiable.

Title: Sagan Standard
Summary: Extraordinary claims require extraordinary evidence.

Title: Memento Mori
Summary: Remember that your time is finite and you will inevitably die.

Title: Chesterton's Fence
Summary: Don't change a system or rule until you understand why it exists.

Title: Swiss Cheese Model
Summary: No safeguard is perfect so use multiple to prevent a single point of failure.

Title: Bus Factor
Summary: The risk of losing critical knowledge if key team members leave or die.

Title: Idea Metaphors
Summary: Location (movement), object (manipulated), and food (consumed)

Title: Rose, Thorn, And Bud Model
Summary: "What is going well?", "What is not working?", and "What could we try?”

Title: XY Problem
Summary: Ensure the root cause of a problem is correctly identified before finding a solution.

Title: Yak Shaving
Summary: Don’t get sidetracked by small trivial tasks that detract from the main goal.

Title: Decision Heuristics
Summary: Take-the-first, take-the-best, hiatus, default, priority, recognition, fluency, tradeoff, and trial-and-error

Title: Don’t Ask The Barber For A Haircut
Summary: Those who benefit from your decision are incentivized to promote it.

Title: Dunning–Kruger Effect
Summary: Unskilled people often overestimate their abilities and skilled people often underestimate their abilities.

Title: Goodhart's Law
Summary: When a measure becomes a target, it ceases to be a good measure.

Title: Brooks's Law
Summary: Adding manpower to a late software project makes it later.

Title: Hofstadter's Law
Summary: Tasks always take longer than you expect.

Title: Gall's Law
Summary: Functioning complex systems evolve from functioning simple systems.

Title: Pareto Principle
Summary: 80% of outputs tend to come from 20% of inputs.

Title: Tesler's Law
Summary: Every software application has an inherent amount of complexity that cannot be removed or hidden.

Title: Front Page Test
Summary: How would you feel if everyone knew about your actions?

Title: Everybody, Somebody, Anybody, And Nobody
Summary: Take responsibility and don't assume others will do what you won’t.

Title: Relevance Question
Summary: "Will this matter a year from now?”

Title: Productivity Questions
Summary: “What am I doing now?”, “Is it getting me anywhere?", and “What else could I be doing instead?”

Title: Improve Metacognition
Summary: Self-questioning,... think aloud,... and make graphic representations of thoughts and knowledge.

Title: Time Wasters
Summary: Lack of priorities, waiting for inspiration, doing everything yourself, worrying what people will say, not living your life, fearing failure, complaining, unfinished tasks, pleasing everybody, comparing yourself to others, repeating mistakes, and perfectionism

Title: Accountability Mindset
Summary: Acknowledges mistakes, takes responsibility, finds solutions, and makes it happen.

Title: Real Online
Summary: Be real online as anonymity often encourages bad behavior.

Title: Never Just This Once
Summary: It's easier to uphold your principles 100% of the time when you never compromise.

Title: Hope Model
Summary: Desire a future state, see alternative pathways, and believe in your agency and ability to succeed.

Title: Point Positive
Summary: It’s more constructive to point to solutions than to problems.

Title: Civil Conversation Rules
Summary: Reach a shared understanding rather than winning; clarify others’ perspectives; avoid logical fallacies; recognize personal biases and be intellectually humble; be reasonable, rational, and create coherent arguments; avoid personal attacks and mean-spiritedness; apply the principle of charity; and be open to changing your mind.

Title: KISS
Summary: Most systems work and are understood better if they are kept simple.

Title: YAGNI
Summary: Don't implement something until it's necessary.

Title: Simplest-First
Summary: Do the simplest thing that could possibly work.

Title: Separation of Concerns
Summary: Divide a system into distinct sections that handle a single concern.

Title: Code For The Maintainer
Summary: Design and document systems so others can maintain them easily.

Title: Avoid Premature Optimization
Summary: Focus on completing essential parts and optimize later if necessary.

Title: Optimize For Deletion
Summary: Design systems so components can be easily changed later.

Title: DRY
Summary: Avoid duplication and ensure each piece of knowledge has a single source.

Title: Boy Scout Rule
Summary: Leave the campground cleaner than you found it.

Title: The Two Wolves
Summary: There is a good and evil wolf within us and the one you feed the most prevails.

Title: The Greatest Command
Summary: Love God wholly and love your neighbour as yourself.

Title: 4000 Weeks
Summary: If you live to be 80 then you have 4000 weeks to live.

Title: The Map Is Not the Territory
Summary: Mental models are useful abstractions that simplify the complexity of reality but don't caputure everything.

Title: Metathinking Process
Summary: Deep (research/define), wide (creative/divergent), narrow (critical/convergent), and up (synthesize/iterate).

Title: Growth Mindset
Summary: The belief that intelligence and psychological capabilities can be developed through effort.

Title: Maslow's Hierarchy Of Needs
Summary: Physiological, Safety, Love And Belonging, Esteem, and Self-actualisation

Title: Circle Of Competence
Summary: Stay within the domains matching your skills and expertise.

Title: First Principles Thinking
Summary: Breakdown problems into fundamental parts to seperate what is absolutely true vs assumptions to build a foundation.

Title: Second-Order Thinking
Summary: Consider the long-term consequences of decisions.

Title: Socratic Questioning
Summary: Clarify thinking and its origin; Challenge assumptions; Request evidence; Explore alternative perspectives and conflicts between contentions; Explore implications and consequences; Question the question.

Title: Law Of Diminishing Returns
Summary: Benefits are never infinitely scalable and tend to decay rapidly at a certain point.

Title: Probabilistic Thinking
Summary: Estimating the likelihood of uncertain events to make better decisions.

Title: Minimum Viable Product
Summary: Create a basic useable product that focuses on key features to quickly challenge assumptions and gather feedback.

Title: Destiny Instinct
Summary: Small changes lead to big changes over time.

Title: Boiling Frog
Summary: Slow changes often go unnoticed until it’s too late.

Title: Front Of House, Back Of House
Summary: Don’t compare your messy behind-the-scenes to others’ polished front.

Title: Modes Of Persuasion
Summary: Appeal to: ethos (authority and credibility), pathos (emotion), logos (logic and reason), and kairos (timeliness and context).

Title: Burden Of Proof
Summary: The party making a claim must provide evidence to prove its validity.

Title: Thought Experiment Questions
Summary: “What might happen if X?”, “What might have happened if X?”, "What would someone do if X?", and "What would I do if X?"

Title: Brainstorming Tips
Summary: Define a clear single-target problem statement, generate as many ideas as possible, postpone criticism, welcome wild ideas, and combine and improve ideas.

Title: Speech Responsibility
Summary: Be accountable for the consequences of what you say or don’t say.

Title: Balanced Decision Making
Summary: Evaluate alternatives by weighing their benefits, drawbacks, and likelihoods.

Title: Missing Information
Summary: Delay decisions when critical information is missing to gather more information.

Title: Time-sensitive Decisions
Summary: Short timeframes favour intuition and gut feelings and long timeframes favour examining ambiguities and assessing contradictory information.
